Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2011 04:09PM - edited Dec 15, 2011 04:12PM by acousy31 Hi  I jst read your post, Im 31 with 3 sons and I had my appointment today they examined me, gave me an ultrasound and a core needle biospy  i have a 7mm hard mass and I will get the results next thursday its goin to be a very long week I was like you trying not to worry but of course you do, I hope everything works out for you keep you posted just keep taking the advice I got from the lovely people on this site that 80% of lumbs are benign

Posts.Content: acousy31 wrote: Hi I am newbie on this site, I found a lump on my left breast about a year and a half ago and I went to my GP who examined me and said it most likly to be cyst and that was the end of it, in the past few weeks I noticed a little tingling pain from it occassionaly not every day so I went back to my GP and {(different GP) and explained how I had been before she did not give me a full examination she just felt the lump it  as I showed her where it was and said she would send me for a biospy more likly to be a cyst and may need the fluid drained out if its uncomfortable, I am totally freaked I am mother of 3, and I have read online that cysts are usually soft and move around my lump is the size of a bean, rock hard and doesnt move going for biospy 15th december that is the earliest apt I can get went doc two weeks ago... any advice are my freaking out completely Log in to post a reply
